IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "docs/DATABASE_SCHEMA.md", "file_content": "# ROSTRY Database Schema Documentation\n\n> **Version**: 6.0 \n> **Last Updated**: 2025-01-08 \n> **Database Type**: Hybrid (Room + Firestore) \n> **Status**: Current Implementation \n\n## \ud83d\udccb Overview\n\nROSTRY uses a hybrid database architecture combining Room (local SQLite) for offline capabilities and Firebase Firestore (cloud NoSQL) for real-time synchronization and backup.\n\n## \ud83c\udfd7\ufe0f Database Architecture\n\n### Hybrid Strategy Benefits\n- **Offline Support**: Room provides local data access when network is unavailable\n- **Real-time Sync**: Firestore enables real-time updates across devices\n- **Performance**: Local queries are fast, cloud provides backup and sync\n- **Scalability**: Firestore handles concurrent users and data growth\n\n### Data Flow Pattern\n```\nUser Action \u2192 Repository \u2192 Local DB (Room) \u2192 Cloud DB (Firestore)\n \u2193\nUI Updates \u2190 Flow/LiveData \u2190 Local DB \u2190 Sync \u2190 Cloud DB\n```\n\n## \ud83d\uddc4\ufe0f Room Database (Local Storage)\n\n### Database Configuration\n```kotlin\n@Database(\n entities = [\n User::class,\n Fowl::class,\n Post::class,\n Chat::class,\n Message::class,\n CartItem::class,\n FowlRecord::class,\n TransferLog::class,\n MarketplaceListing::class,\n Order::class,\n Wallet::class,\n CoinTransaction::class,\n VerificationRequest::class,\n ShowcaseSlot::class,\n FlockSummary::class\n ],\n version = 6,\n exportSchema = false\n)\n@TypeConverters(Converters::class)\nabstract class RostryDatabase : RoomDatabase()\n```\n\n### Entity Schemas\n\n#### 1. User Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE users (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n email TEXT NOT NULL,\n displayName TEXT NOT NULL,\n profileImageUrl TEXT NOT NULL,\n role TEXT NOT NULL,\n phoneNumber TEXT NOT NULL,\n location TEXT NOT NULL,\n bio TEXT NOT NULL,\n isKycVerified INTEGER NOT NULL,\n kycDocumentUrl TEXT NOT NULL,\n verificationStatus TEXT NOT NULL,\n verificationBadges TEXT NOT NULL,\n coinBalance INTEGER NOT NULL,\n totalCoinsEarned INTEGER NOT NULL,\n totalCoinsSpent INTEGER NOT NULL,\n sellerRating REAL NOT NULL,\n totalSales INTEGER NOT NULL,\n joinedDate INTEGER NOT NULL,\n createdAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n updatedAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n isOnline INTEGER NOT NULL,\n lastSeen INTEGER NOT NULL\n);\n```\n\n#### 2. Fowl Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE fowls (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n ownerId TEXT NOT NULL,\n name TEXT NOT NULL,\n breed TEXT NOT NULL,\n type TEXT NOT NULL,\n gender TEXT NOT NULL,\n dateOfBirth INTEGER,\n motherId TEXT,\n fatherId TEXT,\n dateOfHatching INTEGER NOT NULL,\n initialCount INTEGER,\n status TEXT NOT NULL,\n weight REAL NOT NULL,\n color TEXT NOT NULL,\n description TEXT NOT NULL,\n imageUrls TEXT NOT NULL,\n proofImageUrl TEXT,\n healthRecords TEXT NOT NULL,\n isForSale INTEGER NOT NULL,\n price REAL NOT NULL,\n location TEXT NOT NULL,\n createdAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n updatedAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n \n FOREIGN KEY(ownerId) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE\n);\n```\n\n#### 3. Post Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE posts (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n authorId TEXT NOT NULL,\n content TEXT NOT NULL,\n imageUrls TEXT NOT NULL,\n likes INTEGER NOT NULL,\n comments INTEGER NOT NULL,\n shares INTEGER NOT NULL,\n isPublic INTEGER NOT NULL,\n createdAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n updatedAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n \n FOREIGN KEY(authorId) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE\n);\n```\n\n#### 4. Chat Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE chats (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n participantIds TEXT NOT NULL,\n lastMessage TEXT NOT NULL,\n lastMessageTime INTEGER NOT NULL,\n unreadCount INTEGER NOT NULL,\n createdAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n updatedAt INTEGER NOT NULL\n);\n```\n\n#### 5. Message Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE messages (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n chatId TEXT NOT NULL,\n senderId TEXT NOT NULL,\n content TEXT NOT NULL,\n messageType TEXT NOT NULL,\n imageUrl TEXT,\n timestamp INTEGER NOT NULL,\n isRead INTEGER NOT NULL,\n \n FOREIGN KEY(chatId) REFERENCES chats(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,\n FOREIGN KEY(senderId) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE\n);\n```\n\n#### 6. Order Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE orders (\n orderId TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n buyerId TEXT NOT NULL,\n sellerId TEXT NOT NULL,\n fowlId TEXT NOT NULL,\n quantity INTEGER NOT NULL,\n unitPrice REAL NOT NULL,\n totalAmount REAL NOT NULL,\n status TEXT NOT NULL,\n paymentMethod TEXT NOT NULL,\n deliveryAddress TEXT NOT NULL,\n deliveryMethod TEXT NOT NULL,\n notes TEXT NOT NULL,\n createdAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n updatedAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n \n FOREIGN KEY(buyerId) REFERENCES users(id),\n FOREIGN KEY(sellerId) REFERENCES users(id),\n FOREIGN KEY(fowlId) REFERENCES fowls(id)\n);\n```\n\n#### 7. Wallet Table\n```sql\nCREATE TABLE wallets (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n userId TEXT NOT NULL,\n coinBalance INTEGER NOT NULL,\n totalEarned INTEGER NOT NULL,\n totalSpent INTEGER NOT NULL,\n lastTransactionDate INTEGER NOT NULL,\n createdAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n updatedAt INTEGER NOT NULL,\n \n FOREIGN KEY(userId) REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE\n);\n```\n\n### Database Indexes\n```sql\n-- Performance optimization indexes\nCREATE INDEX idx_fowls_owner ON fowls(ownerId);\nCREATE INDEX idx_fowls_for_sale ON fowls(isForSale);\nCREATE INDEX idx_fowls_type ON fowls(type);\nCREATE INDEX idx_messages_chat ON messages(chatId);\nCREATE INDEX idx_orders_buyer ON orders(buyerId);\nCREATE INDEX idx_orders_seller ON orders(sellerId);\nCREATE INDEX idx_posts_author ON posts(authorId);\n```\n\n### Migration History\n```kotlin\n// Migration from version 5 to 6\nval MIGRATION_5_6 = object : Migration(5, 6) {\n override fun migrate(database: SupportSQLiteDatabase) {\n // Add FlockSummary table\n database.execSQL(\"\"\"\n CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS flockSummary (\n id TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,\n userId TEXT NOT NULL,\n totalFowls INTEGER NOT NULL,\n totalValue REAL NOT NULL,\n healthyCount INTEGER NOT NULL,\n sickCount INTEGER NOT NULL,\n forSaleCount INTEGER NOT NULL,\n lastUpdated INTEGER NOT NULL\n )\n \"\"\")\n }\n}\n```\n\n## \u2601\ufe0f Firestore Database (Cloud Storage)\n\n### Collection Structure\n```\nrostry-firestore/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 users/ # User profiles\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 {userId}/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 profile data\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 subcollections/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 fowls/ # User's fowls\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 orders/ # User's orders\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 transactions/ # Coin transactions\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 fowls/ # All fowl entities\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 {fowlId}/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 fowl data\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 subcollections/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 records/ # Health records\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 transfers/ # Transfer history\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 chats/ # Chat conversations\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 {chatId}/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 chat metadata\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 messages/ # Chat messages\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 posts/ # Social posts\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 orders/ # Purchase orders\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 marketplace/ # Marketplace listings\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 verifications/ # KYC verification requests\n```\n\n### Document Schemas\n\n#### User Document\n```json\n{\n \"id\": \"string\",\n \"email\": \"string\",\n \"displayName\": \"string\",\n \"profileImageUrl\": \"string\",\n \"role\": \"GENERAL|FARMER|ENTHUSIAST\",\n \"phoneNumber\": \"string\",\n \"location\": \"string\",\n \"bio\": \"string\",\n \"isKycVerified\": \"boolean\",\n \"verificationStatus\": \"UNVERIFIED|PENDING|VERIFIED|REJECTED\",\n \"verificationBadges\": [\"string\"],\n \"coinBalance\": \"number\",\n \"sellerRating\": \"number\",\n \"totalSales\": \"number\",\n \"isOnline\": \"boolean\",\n \"lastSeen\": \"timestamp\",\n \"createdAt\": \"timestamp\",\n \"updatedAt\": \"timestamp\"\n}\n```\n\n#### Fowl Document\n```json\n{\n \"id\": \"string\",\n \"ownerId\": \"string\",\n \"name\": \"string\",\n \"breed\": \"string\",\n \"type\": \"CHICKEN|DUCK|TURKEY|GOOSE|GUINEA_FOWL|OTHER\",\n \"gender\": \"MALE|FEMALE|UNKNOWN\",\n \"dateOfBirth\": \"timestamp\",\n \"motherId\": \"string\",\n \"fatherId\": \"string\",\n \"status\": \"string\",\n \"weight\": \"number\",\n \"description\": \"string\",\n \"imageUrls\": [\"string\"],\n \"healthRecords\": [\n {\n \"id\": \"string\",\n \"date\": \"timestamp\",\n \"type\": \"CHECKUP|VACCINATION|TREATMENT|WEIGHT_CHECK|OTHER\",\n \"description\": \"string\",\n \"veterinarian\": \"string\",\n \"medication\": \"string\",\n \"notes\": \"string\"\n }\n ],\n \"isForSale\": \"boolean\",\n \"price\": \"number\",\n \"location\": \"string\",\n \"createdAt\": \"timestamp\",\n \"updatedAt\": \"timestamp\"\n}\n```\n\n#### Order Document\n```json\n{\n \"orderId\": \"string\",\n \"buyerId\": \"string\",\n \"sellerId\": \"string\",\n \"fowlId\": \"string\",\n \"quantity\": \"number\",\n \"unitPrice\": \"number\",\n \"totalAmount\": \"number\",\n \"status\": \"PENDING|CONFIRMED|SHIPPED|DELIVERED|CANCELLED|REFUNDED\",\n \"paymentMethod\": \"string\",\n \"deliveryAddress\": \"string\",\n \"deliveryMethod\": \"PICKUP|DELIVERY|SHIPPING\",\n \"notes\": \"string\",\n \"createdAt\": \"timestamp\",\n \"updatedAt\": \"timestamp\"\n}\n```\n\n### Firestore Security Rules\n```javascript\nrules_version = '2';\nservice cloud.firestore {\n match /databases/{database}/documents {\n // Users can read/write their own data\n match /users/{userId} {\n allow read, write: if request.auth != null && request.auth.uid == userId;\n }\n \n // Fowls can be read by anyone, written by owner\n match /fowls/{fowlId} {\n allow read: if request.auth != null;\n allow write: if request.auth != null && \n request.auth.uid == resource.data.ownerId;\n }\n \n // Orders can be accessed by buyer or seller\n match /orders/{orderId} {\n allow read, write: if request.auth != null && \n (request.auth.uid == resource.data.buyerId || \n request.auth.uid == resource.data.sellerId);\n }\n \n // Chat participants can access chat data\n match /chats/{chatId} {\n allow read, write: if request.auth != null && \n request.auth.uid in resource.data.participantIds;\n }\n }\n}\n```\n\n## \ud83d\udd04 Data Synchronization\n\n### Sync Strategy\n```kotlin\nclass DataSyncManager @Inject constructor(\n private val localDatabase: RostryDatabase,\n private val firestore: FirebaseFirestore\n) {\n \n suspend fun syncUserData(userId: String) {\n try {\n // Fetch from Firestore\n val userDoc = firestore.collection(\"users\").document(userId).get().await()\n val user = userDoc.toObject<User>()\n \n // Update local database\n user?.let { localDatabase.userDao().insertUser(it) }\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n // Handle sync failure\n Log.e(\"DataSync\", \"Failed to sync user data\", e)\n }\n }\n \n suspend fun syncFowlData(ownerId: String) {\n try {\n // Fetch user's fowls from Firestore\n val fowlsSnapshot = firestore.collection(\"fowls\")\n .whereEqualTo(\"ownerId\", ownerId)\n .get()\n .await()\n \n val fowls = fowlsSnapshot.toObjects<Fowl>()\n \n // Update local database\n localDatabase.fowlDao().insertAll(fowls)\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Log.e(\"DataSync\", \"Failed to sync fowl data\", e)\n }\n }\n}\n```\n\n### Conflict Resolution\n```kotlin\n// Last-write-wins strategy for conflict resolution\nsuspend fun resolveConflict(localEntity: Entity, remoteEntity: Entity): Entity {\n return if (remoteEntity.updatedAt > localEntity.updatedAt) {\n remoteEntity\n } else {\n localEntity\n }\n}\n```\n\n## \ud83d\udcca Performance Considerations\n\n### Query Optimization\n- **Indexes**: Strategic indexes on frequently queried fields\n- **Pagination**: Limit query results and implement pagination\n- **Caching**: Room provides automatic caching for offline access\n- **Batch Operations**: Use batch writes for multiple document updates\n\n### Storage Optimization\n- **Image Compression**: Compress images before storing in Firebase Storage\n- **Data Pruning**: Regular cleanup of old data and logs\n- **Selective Sync**: Only sync necessary data based on user activity\n\n---\n\n**This database schema documentation reflects the current implementation of ROSTRY's data layer and should be used as the definitive reference for database operations.**"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a database schema documentation:

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "docs/DEVELOPMENT_GUIDE.md", "file_content": "# ROSTRY Development Guide\n\n> **Version**: 1.0.0 \n> **Last Updated**: 2025-01-08 \n> **Target Audience**: Developers, Contributors \n\n## \ud83d\ude80 Getting Started\n\n### Prerequisites\n\n#### Required Software\n- **Android Studio**: Hedgehog | 2023.1.1 or later\n- **JDK**: 11 or higher (OpenJDK recommended)\n- **Git**: Latest version\n- **Android SDK**: API 24+ (Android 7.0)\n\n#### Recommended Tools\n- **Gradle**: 8.11.1+ (included with Android Studio)\n- **Kotlin**: 2.0.21+ (included with Android Studio)\n- **Firebase CLI**: For Firebase operations (optional)\n\n### Environment Setup\n\n#### 1. Clone Repository\n```bash\ngit clone https://github.com/company/rostry.git\ncd rostry\n```\n\n#### 2. Android Studio Configuration\n1. Open Android Studio\n2. Select \"Open an existing project\"\n3. Navigate to the cloned `rostry` directory\n4. Wait for Gradle sync to complete\n\n#### 3. Firebase Configuration\n1. **Download Configuration File**\n - Go to [Firebase Console](https://console.firebase.google.com)\n - Select your ROSTRY project\n - Download `google-services.json`\n - Place it in `app/` directory\n\n2. **Verify Firebase Services**\n - Authentication: Email/Password enabled\n - Firestore: Database created with proper security rules\n - Storage: Bucket configured for image uploads\n - Crashlytics: Enabled for crash reporting\n\n#### 4. Local Properties Setup\nCreate `local.properties` file in root directory:\n```properties\n# Android SDK location\nsdk.dir=C\\:\\\\Users\\\\YourUsername\\\\AppData\\\\Local\\\\Android\\\\Sdk\n\n# Optional: Firebase project configuration\nfirebase.project.id=your-project-id\n```\n\n### Build Configuration\n\n#### Gradle Configuration\nThe project uses Gradle Version Catalog for dependency management:\n\n```kotlin\n// gradle/libs.versions.toml\n[versions]\nkotlin = \"2.0.21\"\ncompose-bom = \"2024.09.00\"\nhilt = \"2.52\"\nroom = \"2.6.1\"\n# ... other versions\n```\n\n#### Build Variants\n- **Debug**: Development build with debugging enabled\n- **Release**: Production build with ProGuard optimization\n\n#### Build Commands\n```bash\n# Clean build\n./gradlew clean\n\n# Build debug APK\n./gradlew assembleDebug\n\n# Build release APK\n./gradlew assembleRelease\n\n# Install debug APK to connected device\n./gradlew installDebug\n\n# Run tests\n./gradlew test\n./gradlew connectedAndroidTest\n```\n\n## \ud83c\udfd7\ufe0f Project Architecture\n\n### Package Structure\n```\ncom.rio.rostry/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 MainActivity.kt # App entry point\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 RostryApplication.kt # Application class\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 data/ # Data layer\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 local/ # Room database\n\u2502 \u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 dao/ # Data Access Objects\n\u2502 \u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 RostryDatabase.kt # Database configuration\n\u2502 \u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 Converters.kt # Type converters\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 model/ # Data entities\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 repository/ # Repository implementations\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 di/ # Dependency injection\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 DatabaseModule.kt # Database dependencies\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 FirebaseModule.kt # Firebase dependencies\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 RepositoryModule.kt # Repository dependencies\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 domain/ # Business logic\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 ui/ # Presentation layer\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 auth/ # Authentication screens\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 fowls/ # Fowl management\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 marketplace/ # Trading features\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 home/ # Social feed\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 chat/ # Messaging\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 dashboard/ # Analytics\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 profile/ # User management\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 wallet/ # Monetization\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 verification/ # KYC system\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 navigation/ # Navigation setup\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 theme/ # UI theming\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 util/ # Utility classes\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 viewmodel/ # Shared ViewModels\n```\n\n### Architecture Patterns\n- **MVVM**: Model-View-ViewModel pattern\n- **Repository Pattern**: Data access abstraction\n- **Clean Architecture**: Separation of concerns\n- **Dependency Injection**: Hilt for DI\n\n## \ud83d\udee0\ufe0f Development Workflow\n\n### Git Workflow\n```bash\n# Create feature branch\ngit checkout -b feature/your-feature-name\n\n# Make changes and commit\ngit add .\ngit commit -m \"feat: add your feature description\"\n\n# Push to remote\ngit push origin feature/your-feature-name\n\n# Create Pull Request on GitHub\n```\n\n### Commit Message Convention\n```\ntype(scope): description\n\nTypes:\n- feat: New feature\n- fix: Bug fix\n- docs: Documentation changes\n- style: Code style changes\n- refactor: Code refactoring\n- test: Test additions/modifications\n- chore: Build process or auxiliary tool changes\n\nExamples:\nfeat(fowls): add fowl breeding lineage tracking\nfix(auth): resolve login validation issue\ndocs(api): update repository documentation\n```\n\n### Code Style Guidelines\n\n#### Kotlin Style\n```kotlin\n// Use descriptive names\nclass FowlRepository @Inject constructor(\n private val firestore: FirebaseFirestore,\n private val fowlDao: FowlDao\n) {\n \n // Use suspend functions for async operations\n suspend fun addFowl(fowl: Fowl): Result<String> {\n return try {\n // Implementation\n Result.success(fowlId)\n } catch (e: Exception) {\n Result.failure(e)\n }\n }\n \n // Use Flow for reactive data\n fun getFowlsByOwnerFlow(ownerId: String): Flow<List<Fowl>> {\n return fowlDao.getFowlsByOwnerFlow(ownerId)\n }\n}\n```\n\n#### Compose UI Style\n```kotlin\n@Composable\nfun FowlCard(\n fowl: Fowl,\n onFowlClick: (String) -> Unit,\n modifier: Modifier = Modifier\n) {\n Card(\n modifier = modifier\n .fillMaxWidth()\n .clickable { onFowlClick(fowl.id) },\n elevation = CardDefaults.cardElevation(defaultElevation = 4.dp)\n ) {\n // Card content\n }\n}\n```\n\n### Testing Strategy\n\n#### Unit Tests\n```kotlin\n@Test\nfun `addFowl should return success when fowl is valid`() = runTest {\n // Given\n val fowl = Fowl(name = \"Test Fowl\", breed = \"Test Breed\")\n \n // When\n val result = fowlRepository.addFowl(fowl)\n \n // Then\n assertTrue(result.isSuccess)\n}\n```\n\n#### UI Tests\n```kotlin\n@Test\nfun testFowlListDisplayed() {\n composeTestRule.setContent {\n RostryTheme {\n MyFowlsScreen(\n onNavigateToAddFowl = {},\n onNavigateToFowlDetail = {}\n )\n }\n }\n \n composeTestRule.onNodeWithText(\"My Fowls\").assertIsDisplayed()\n}\n```\n\n### Debugging\n\n#### Common Issues & Solutions\n\n1. **Build Failures**\n ```bash\n # Clean and rebuild\n ./gradlew clean\n ./gradlew build\n \n # Check for dependency conflicts\n ./gradlew dependencies\n ```\n\n2. **Firebase Connection Issues**\n - Verify `google-services.json` is in correct location\n - Check Firebase project configuration\n - Ensure internet connectivity\n\n3. **Database Migration Issues**\n ```kotlin\n // Add fallback migration\n .fallbackToDestructiveMigration()\n ```\n\n#### Logging\n```kotlin\n// Use structured logging\nLog.d(\"FowlRepository\", \"Adding fowl: ${fowl.name}\")\nLog.e(\"FowlRepository\", \"Failed to add fowl\", exception)\n\n// Use Timber for production logging (if implemented)\nTimber.d(\"Adding fowl: %s\", fowl.name)\n```\n\n## \ud83e\uddea Testing\n\n### Test Structure\n```\nsrc/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 test/ # Unit tests\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 java/com/rio/rostry/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 repository/ # Repository tests\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 viewmodel/ # ViewModel tests\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 util/ # Utility tests\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 androidTest/ # Instrumented tests\n \u2514\u2500\u2500 java/com/rio/rostry/\n \u251c\u2500\u2500 database/ # Database tests\n \u251c\u2500\u2500 ui/ # UI tests\n \u2514\u2500\u2500 integration/ # Integration tests\n```\n\n### Running Tests\n```bash\n# Unit tests\n./gradlew test\n\n# Instrumented tests (requires connected device/emulator)\n./gradlew connectedAndroidTest\n\n# Specific test class\n./gradlew test --tests \"FowlRepositoryTest\"\n\n# Test with coverage\n./gradlew testDebugUnitTestCoverage\n```\n\n### Test Configuration\n```kotlin\n// Test dependencies in build.gradle.kts\ntestImplementation(libs.junit)\ntestImplementation(libs.mockito.core)\ntestImplementation(libs.coroutines.test)\nandroidTestImplementation(libs.androidx.junit)\nandroidTestImplementation(libs.androidx.espresso.core)\nandroidTestImplementation(libs.compose.ui.test.junit4)\n```\n\n## \ud83d\ude80 Deployment\n\n### Debug Deployment\n```bash\n# Quick deployment script\n./quick_start.bat\n\n# Manual deployment\n./gradlew installDebug\nadb shell am start -n com.rio.rostry/.MainActivity\n```\n\n### Release Deployment\n```bash\n# Build release APK\n./gradlew assembleRelease\n\n# Sign APK (if keystore configured)\n./gradlew bundleRelease\n```\n\n### Development Scripts\n- `quick_start.bat` - Build and install debug APK\n- `run_app.bat` - Launch application on device\n- `run_all_tests.bat` - Execute complete test suite\n- `verify_monetization.bat` - Test monetization features\n\n## \ud83d\udcda Resources\n\n### Documentation\n- [Project Blueprint](PROJECT_BLUEPRINT.md)\n- [API Documentation](API_DOCUMENTATION.md)\n- [Database Schema](DATABASE_SCHEMA.md)\n- [Architecture Overview](ARCHITECTURE_SNAPSHOT.md)\n\n### External Resources\n- [Android Developer Guide](https://developer.android.com)\n- [Jetpack Compose Documentation](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/compose)\n- [Firebase Documentation](https://firebase.google.com/docs)\n- [Kotlin Documentation](https://kotlinlang.org/docs)\n\n### Community\n- [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/company/rostry/issues)\n- [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/company/rostry/discussions)\n- [Development Team Slack](https://rostry-team.slack.com)\n\n## \ud83e\udd1d Contributing\n\n### Pull Request Process\n1. Fork the repository\n2. Create a feature branch\n3. Make your changes\n4. Add/update tests\n5. Update documentation\n6. Submit pull request\n\n### Code Review Guidelines\n- Code follows project style guidelines\n- All tests pass\n- Documentation is updated\n- No breaking changes without discussion\n- Performance impact considered\n\n### Issue Reporting\nWhen reporting issues, include:\n- Android version and device model\n- Steps to reproduce\n- Expected vs actual behavior\n- Relevant logs or screenshots\n- App version and build variant\n\n---\n\n**This development guide provides the foundation for contributing to ROSTRY.  1	# ROSTRY Architecture Snapshot
 2	## Complete Developer Guide Reference
 3	
 4	> **Last Updated**: 2024-07-29 
 5	> **Version**: 1.0.0 
 6	> **Build Status**: Successfully Building 
 7	> **APK Size**: ~18MB 
 8	> **Target SDK**: 36 (Android 14+)
 9	
 10	---
 11	
 12	## **Project Overview**
 13	
 14	**ROSTRY** is a comprehensive **Fowl Management & Marketplace Android Application** built with modern Android development practices. It serves as a complete ecosystem for poultry farmers, breeders, and enthusiasts to manage their flocks, trade fowls, and connect with the community.
 15	
 16	### **Core Business Domain**
 17	- **Primary**: Fowl lifecycle management (chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc.)
 18	- **Secondary**: Marketplace for buying/selling fowls
 19	- **Tertiary**: Social community features and verification systems
 20	- **Monetization**: Coin-based economy with premium features
 21	
 22	---
 23	
 24	## **Application Architecture**
 25	
 26	### **Architecture Pattern: MVVM + Repository + Clean Architecture**
 27	
 28	```
 29	
 30	 PRESENTATION LAYER 
 31	
 32	 UI (Jetpack Compose) ViewModels Navigation Theme 
 33	
 34	 DOMAIN LAYER 
 35	
 36	 Use Cases Business Logic Domain Models Interfaces 
 37	
 38	 DATA LAYER 
 39	
 40	 Repositories Data Sources Local DB Remote API 
 41	
 42	 INFRASTRUCTURE LAYER 
 43	
 44	 Firebase Room Database Dependency Injection Utils 
 45	
 46	```
 47	
 48	---
 49	
 50	## **Technology Stack**
 51	
 52	### **Core Technologies**
 53	```kotlin
 54	// Build Configuration
 55	compileSdk = 36
 56	minSdk = 24
 57	targetSdk = 36
 58	kotlinVersion = "2.0+"
 59	jvmTarget = "11"
 60	```
 61	
 62	### **Key Dependencies**
 63	| **Category** | **Library** | **Version** | **Purpose** |
 64	|--------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|
 65	| **UI Framework** | Jetpack Compose | Latest | Modern declarative UI |
 66	| **Architecture** | MVVM + Hilt | Latest | Dependency injection & architecture |
 67	| **Database** | Room + Firebase Firestore | Latest | Local & cloud data persistence |
 68	| **Authentication** | Firebase Auth | Latest | User authentication & management |
 69	| **Storage** | Firebase Storage | Latest | Image and file storage |
 70	| **Navigation** | Navigation Compose | Latest | Screen navigation |
 71	| **Image Loading** | Coil | Latest | Async image loading |
 72	| **Async** | Kotlin Coroutines | Latest | Asynchronous programming |
 73	| **Monitoring** | Firebase Crashlytics | Latest | Crash reporting |
 74	
 75	---
 76	
 77	## **Project Structure Deep Dive**
 78	
 79	### **Package Organization**
 80	```
 81	com.rio.rostry/
 82	 MainActivity.kt # Entry point
 83	 RostryApplication.kt # Application class with Hilt
 84	 config/ # App configuration
 85	 data/ # Data layer
 86	 local/ # Local database (Room)
 87	 dao/ # Data Access Objects (15 DAOs)
 88	 RostryDatabase.kt # Room database configuration
 89	 Converters.kt # Type converters for Room
 90	 model/ # Data models (20+ entities)
 91	 repository/ # Repository implementations (12 repos)
 92	 domain/ # Business logic layer
 93	 ui/ # Presentation layer
 94	 auth/ # Authentication screens
 95	 dashboard/ # Dashboard & analytics
 96	 fowls/ # Fowl management screens
 97	 marketplace/ # Marketplace & trading
 98	 chat/ # Messaging system
 99	 profile/ # User profile management
 100	 wallet/ # Monetization features

 110	
 111	## **Database Architecture**
 112	
 113	### **Hybrid Database Strategy: Room + Firestore**
 114	
 115	#### **Local Database (Room) - 15 Entities**
 116	```kotlin
 117	@Database(
 118	 entities = [
 119	 User::class, // User profiles and authentication
 120	 Fowl::class, // Core fowl entities
 121	 Post::class, // Social media posts
 122	 Chat::class, // Chat conversations
 123	 Message::class, // Individual messages
 124	 CartItem::class, // Shopping cart items
 125	 FowlRecord::class, // Health and breeding records
 126	 TransferLog::class, // Ownership transfer logs
 127	 MarketplaceListing::class, // Marketplace listings
 128	 Order::class, // Purchase orders
 129	 Wallet::class, // User wallet data
 130	 CoinTransaction::class, // Coin transaction history
 131	 VerificationRequest::class, // KYC verification requests
 132	 ShowcaseSlot::class, // Premium showcase slots
 133	 FlockSummary::class // Dashboard summary data
 134	 ],
 135	 version = 6,
 136	 exportSchema = false
 137	)
 138	```
 139	
 140	#### **Database Migration Strategy**
 141	- **Current Version**: 6
 142	- **Migration Path**: 123456
 143	- **Strategy**: Incremental migrations with fallback to destructive migration
 144	- **Key Migrations**:
 145	 - v1v2: Added fowl records and transfer logs
 146	 - v2v3: Added monetization features (orders, wallet, verification)
 147	 - v3v4: Enhanced user profiles with KYC fields
 148	 - v4v5: Fixed fowl table schema inconsistencies
 149	 - v5v6: Added dashboard summary tables
 150	
 151	#### **Data Synchronization Pattern**
 152	```kotlin
 153	// Hybrid sync strategy
 154	suspend fun syncData() {
 155	 try {
 156	 // 1. Fetch from Firestore (source of truth)
 157	 val remoteData = firestore.collection("fowls").get().await()
 158	 
 159	 // 2. Update local Room database
 160	 localDao.insertAll(remoteData.toObjects<Fowl>())
 161	 
 162	 // 3. Return local data for immediate UI updates
 163	 return localDao.getAllFowls()
 164	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 165	 // 4. Fallback to local data if network fails
 166	 return localDao.getAllFowls()
 167	 }
 168	}
 169	```
 170	
 171	---

","isError":false,"requestId":""}},"47adbe47-956f-4ffc-8a8c-fb89e7c54e19;toolu_vrtx_01SSAdbxR9kaGBPcGDWZrQZm":{"requestId":"47adbe47-956f-4ffc-8a8c-fb89e7c54e19","toolUseId":"toolu_vrtx_01SSAdbxR9kaGBPcGDWZrQZm","phase":5,"result":{"text":"Here's the result of running `cat -n` on docs/duplication-elimination-strategy.md:
 1	# Documentation Duplication Elimination Strategy
 2	
 3	## Automated Duplication Detection
 4	
 5	### 1. Content Analysis Tools
 6	
 7	#### Similarity Detection Algorithm
 8	```python
 9	# Documentation similarity checker
 10	import difflib
 11	from pathlib import Path
 12	
 13	def detect_duplicate_content(docs_directory):
 14	 """
 15	 Detect duplicate or highly similar documentation content
 16	 """
 17	 documents = []
 18	 for doc_file in Path(docs_directory).rglob("*.md"):
 19	 with open(doc_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
 20	 content = f.read()
 21	 documents.append((doc_file.name, content))
 22	 
 23	 duplicates = []
 24	 for i, (name1, content1) in enumerate(documents):
 25	 for j, (name2, content2) in enumerate(documents[i+1:], i+1):
 26	 similarity = difflib.SequenceMatcher(None, content1, content2).ratio()
 27	 if similarity > 0.8: # 80% similarity threshold
 28	 duplicates.append((name1, name2, similarity))
 29	 
 30	 return duplicates
 31	```
 32	
 33	#### Automated Deduplication Process
 34	```bash
 35	#!/bin/bash
 36	# Weekly duplication check script
 37	python scripts/detect_duplicates.py --threshold 0.8
 38	python scripts/merge_similar_docs.py --auto-merge 0.95
 39	python scripts/generate_dedup_report.py
 40	```
 41	
 42	### 2. Content Consolidation Framework
 43	
 44	#### Single Source of Truth (SSOT) Principles
 45	- **API Documentation**: Generated from code annotations
 46	- **Architecture Diagrams**: Generated from code structure
 47	- **Configuration Docs**: Generated from config files
 48	- **User Guides**: Maintained in dedicated repository
 49	
 50	#### Reference-Based Documentation
 51	```markdown
 52	<!-- Instead of duplicating content -->
 53	## Database Schema
 54	See: [Database Documentation](../database/schema.md#fowl-entity)
 55	
 56	<!-- Use includes for shared content -->
 57	{{< include "shared/authentication-flow.md" >}}
 58	
 59	<!-- Link to canonical sources -->
 60	For API endpoints, see: [API Reference](https://api.rostry.com/docs)
 61	```
 62	
 63	### 3. Content Governance Model
 64	
 65	#### Documentation Ownership Matrix
 66	| **Content Type** | **Primary Owner** | **Secondary Owner** | **Update Trigger** |
 67	|------------------|-------------------|---------------------|-------------------|
 68	| API Docs | Backend Team | DevOps Team | Code deployment |
 69	| UI/UX Guides | Frontend Team | Design Team | UI changes |
 70	| Architecture | Tech Lead | Senior Developers | Major releases |
 71	| User Manuals | Product Team | QA Team | Feature releases |
 72	| Deployment | DevOps Team | Backend Team | Infrastructure changes |
 73	
 74	#### Consolidation Rules
 75	1. **Merge Similar**: Documents with >90% similarity
 76	2. **Reference Common**: Shared procedures and standards
 77	3. **Archive Outdated**: Documents not updated in 6 months
 78	4. **Redirect Legacy**: Old URLs point to current content
 79	
 80	### 4. Maintenance Automation
 81	
 82	#### Scheduled Cleanup Tasks
 83	```yaml
 84	# GitHub Actions workflow
 85	name: Documentation Cleanup
 86	schedule:
 87	 - cron: '0 2 * * 1' # Weekly on Monday 2 AM
 88	
 89	jobs:
 90	 cleanup:
 91	 steps:
 92	 - name: Detect Duplicates
 93	 run: python scripts/detect_duplicates.py
 94	 - name: Archive Outdated
 95	 run: python scripts/archive_outdated.py --days 180
 96	 - name: Update Cross-References
 97	 run: python scripts/update_references.py
 98	 - name: Generate Cleanup Report
 99	 run: python scripts/generate_cleanup_report.py
 100	```

 187	### 4. Analytics and Reporting
 188	
 189	#### Feedback Analytics Dashboard
 190	```sql
 191	-- Documentation feedback analytics queries
 192	-- Most problematic documents
 193	SELECT 
 194	 document_path,
 195	 AVG(rating) as avg_rating,
 196	 COUNT(*) as feedback_count,
 197	 COUNT(CASE WHEN rating <= 2 THEN 1 END) as negative_feedback
 198	FROM documentation_feedback 
 199	WHERE created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
 200	GROUP BY document_path
 201	HAVING COUNT(*) >= 5
 202	ORDER BY avg_rating ASC, negative_feedback DESC;
 203	
 204	-- Feedback trends over time
 205	SELECT 
 206	 DATE_TRUNC('week', created_at) as week,
 207	 category,
 208	 COUNT(*) as feedback_count,
 209	 AVG(rating) as avg_rating
 210	FROM documentation_feedback
 211	WHERE created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '90 days'
 212	GROUP BY week, category
 213	ORDER BY week DESC, feedback_count DESC;
 214	
 215	-- User role feedback patterns
 216	SELECT 
 217	 user_role,
 218	 category,
 219	 COUNT(*) as feedback_count,
 220	 AVG(rating) as avg_rating
 221	FROM documentation_feedback
 222	WHERE created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '30 days'
 223	GROUP BY user_role, category
 224	ORDER BY feedback_count DESC;
 225	```
 226	
 227	### 5. Feedback Processing Workflow
 228	
 229	#### Automated Triage System
 230	```python
 231	# Feedback processing and prioritization
 232	import openai
 233	from datetime import datetime, timedelta
 234	
 235	class FeedbackProcessor:
 236	 def __init__(self):
 237	 self.openai_client = openai.OpenAI()
 238	 
 239	 def analyze_feedback(self, feedback):
 240	 """Use AI to analyze and categorize feedback"""
 241	 prompt = f"""
 242	 Analyze this documentation feedback and provide:
 243	 1. Severity level (Low/Medium/High/Critical)
 244	 2. Action required (Update/Clarify/Rewrite/Archive)
 245	 3. Estimated effort (1-5 hours)
 246	 4. Priority score (1-10)
 247	 
 248	 Feedback:
 249	 Rating: {feedback['rating']}/5
 250	 Category: {feedback['category']}
 251	 Comment: {feedback['comment']}
 252	 Document: {feedback['document_path']}
 253	 """
 254	 
 255	 response = self.openai_client.chat.completions.create(
 256	 model="gpt-4",
 257	 messages=[{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
 258	 )
 259	 
 260	 return self.parse_ai_response(response.choices[0].message.content)
 261	 
 262	 def prioritize_feedback(self, feedback_list):
 263	 """Prioritize feedback based on multiple factors"""
 264	 for feedback in feedback_list:
 265	 analysis = self.analyze_feedback(feedback)
 266	 
 267	 # Calculate priority score
 268	 priority_score = (
 269	 (5 - feedback['rating']) * 2 + # Lower rating = higher priority
 270	 self.get_document_importance(feedback['document_path']) +
 271	 analysis['severity_weight'] +
 272	 self.get_user_role_weight(feedback['user_role'])
 273	 )
 274	 
 275	 feedback['priority_score'] = priority_score
 276	 feedback['analysis'] = analysis
 277	 
 278	 return sorted(feedback_list, key=lambda x: x['priority_score'], reverse=True)
 279	
 280	# Automated response system
 281	def send_feedback_acknowledgment(feedback):
 282	 """Send automated response to feedback submitter"""
 283	 if feedback['email']:
 284	 email_template = f"""
 285	 Thank you for your feedback on our documentation!
 286	 
 287	 We've received your feedback about: {feedback['document_path']}
 288	 
 289	 Your feedback has been assigned ticket #DOC-{feedback['id']} and will be 
 290	 reviewed by our documentation team within 2 business days.
 291	 
 292	 Expected resolution time: {get_estimated_resolution_time(feedback)}
 293	 
 294	 You can track the progress at: https://docs.rostry.com/feedback/{feedback['id']}
 295	 """
 296	 
 297	 send_email(feedback['email'], "Documentation Feedback Received", email_template)
 298	```

 1	# MNC Documentation Standards for ROSTRY
 2	
 3	## Corporate Documentation Framework
 4	
 5	### 1. Document Classification System
 6	
 7	#### Security Classifications
 8	- **PUBLIC**: General project information
 9	- **INTERNAL**: Company-specific implementation details
 10	- **CONFIDENTIAL**: Business logic and proprietary algorithms
 11	- **RESTRICTED**: Security configurations and credentials
 12	
 13	#### Document Types
 14	- **ADR**: Architecture Decision Records
 15	- **API**: Application Programming Interface documentation
 16	- **SOP**: Standard Operating Procedures
 17	- **UG**: User Guides
 18	- **TG**: Technical Guides
 19	
 20	### 2. Document Structure Standards
 21	
 22	#### Standard Template Structure
 23	```markdown
 24	# [Document Type] - [Title]
 25	
 26	## Document Information
 27	- **Document ID**: [TYPE]-[PROJECT]-[NUMBER]
 28	- **Version**: [MAJOR].[MINOR].[PATCH]
 29	- **Classification**: [PUBLIC|INTERNAL|CONFIDENTIAL|RESTRICTED]
 30	- **Owner**: [Team/Individual]
 31	- **Reviewers**: [List of reviewers]
 32	- **Last Updated**: [YYYY-MM-DD]
 33	- **Next Review**: [YYYY-MM-DD]
 34	
 35	## Executive Summary
 36	[Brief overview for stakeholders]
 37	
 38	## Content
 39	[Main documentation content]
 40	
 41	## Appendices
 42	[Supporting materials]
 43	
 44	## Change Log
 45	[Version history]
 46	```
 47	
 48	### 3. Quality Assurance Standards
 49	
 50	#### Documentation Quality Metrics
 51	- **Completeness**: 95% of required sections filled
 52	- **Accuracy**: Technical review approval required
 53	- **Clarity**: Readability score > 60 (Flesch-Kincaid)
 54	- **Currency**: Updated within 30 days of code changes
 55	- **Accessibility**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
 56	
 57	#### Review Process
 58	1. **Technical Review**: Subject matter expert validation
 59	2. **Editorial Review**: Language and formatting check
 60	3. **Compliance Review**: Legal and security validation
 61	4. **Stakeholder Review**: Business alignment verification
 62	
 63	### 4. Compliance Requirements
 64	
 65	#### Regulatory Compliance
 66	- **GDPR**: Data handling documentation
 67	- **SOX**: Financial controls documentation
 68	- **ISO 27001**: Information security documentation
 69	- **HIPAA**: Healthcare data protection (if applicable)
 70	
 71	#### Audit Trail Requirements
 72	- All document changes tracked in version control
 73	- Approval workflows documented
 74	- Access logs maintained
 75	- Retention policies enforced
 76	
 77	### 5. Localization Standards
 78	
 79	#### Multi-language Support
 80	- **Primary Language**: English (US)
 81	- **Secondary Languages**: [Based on market requirements]
 82	- **Translation Process**: Professional translation services
 83	- **Cultural Adaptation**: Local compliance requirements
 84	
 85	#### Accessibility Standards
 86	- **Screen Reader Compatible**: Alt text for images
 87	- **Keyboard Navigation**: Full keyboard accessibility
 88	- **Color Contrast**: WCAG AA standards
 89	- **Font Standards**: Minimum 12pt, sans-serif fonts

 1	# Documentation Version Control Strategy
 2	
 3	## Branch-Based Documentation Management
 4	
 5	### Documentation Branching Model
 6	```
 7	main/
 8	 docs/
 9	 api/ # API documentation (auto-generated)
 10	 architecture/ # System design documents
 11	 user-guides/ # End-user documentation
 12	 development/ # Developer guides
 13	 deployment/ # Operations documentation
 14	
 15	develop/
 16	 docs/
 17	 [same structure with WIP content]
 18	
 19	feature/*/
 20	 docs/
 21	 [feature-specific documentation]
 22	```
 23	
 24	## Documentation Lifecycle Management
 25	
 26	### 1. Creation Phase
 27	- **Trigger**: New feature branch creation
 28	- **Action**: Generate documentation templates
 29	- **Validation**: Required sections completion check
 30	
 31	### 2. Development Phase
 32	- **Trigger**: Code commits
 33	- **Action**: Auto-update API docs, validate links
 34	- **Validation**: Documentation coverage metrics
 35	
 36	### 3. Review Phase
 37	- **Trigger**: Pull request creation
 38	- **Action**: Documentation diff review
 39	- **Validation**: Stakeholder approval required
 40	
 41	### 4. Release Phase
 42	- **Trigger**: Merge to main
 43	- **Action**: Publish documentation, archive old versions
 44	- **Validation**: Documentation deployment verification

 111	## **Database Architecture**
 112	
 113	### **Hybrid Database Strategy: Room + Firestore**
 114	
 115	#### **Local Database (Room) - 15 Entities**
 116	```kotlin
 117	@Database(
 118	 entities = [
 119	 User::class, // User profiles and authentication
 120	 Fowl::class, // Core fowl entities
 121	 Post::class, // Social media posts
 122	 Chat::class, // Chat conversations
 123	 Message::class, // Individual messages
 124	 CartItem::class, // Shopping cart items
 125	 FowlRecord::class, // Health and breeding records
 126	 TransferLog::class, // Ownership transfer logs
 127	 MarketplaceListing::class, // Marketplace listings
 128	 Order::class, // Purchase orders
 129	 Wallet::class, // User wallet data
 130	 CoinTransaction::class, // Coin transaction history
 131	 VerificationRequest::class, // KYC verification requests
 132	 ShowcaseSlot::class, // Premium showcase slots
...
 150	
 151	#### **Data Synchronization Pattern**
 152	```kotlin
 153	// Hybrid sync strategy
 154	suspend fun syncData() {
 155	 try {
 156	 // 1. Fetch from Firestore (source of truth)
 157	 val remoteData = firestore.collection("fowls").get().await()
 158	 
 159	 // 2. Update local Room database
 160	 localDao.insertAll(remoteData.toObjects<Fowl>())
 161	 
 162	 // 3. Return local data for immediate UI updates
 163	 return localDao.getAllFowls()
 164	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 165	 // 4. Fallback to local data if network fails
 166	 return localDao.getAllFowls()
 167	 }
 168	}
 169	```

 16	
 17	@Singleton
 18	class FowlRepository @Inject constructor(
 19	 private val firestore: FirebaseFirestore,
 20	 private val storage: FirebaseStorage,
 21	 private val fowlDao: FowlDao
 22	) {
 23	 
 24	 suspend fun addFowl(fowl: Fowl): Result<String> {
 25	 return try {
 26	 val fowlId = fowl.id.ifEmpty { UUID.randomUUID().toString() }
 27	 val fowlWithId = fowl.copy(id = fowlId)
 28	 
 29	 firestore.collection("fowls").document(fowlId).set(fowlWithId).await()
 30	 fowlDao.insertFowl(fowlWithId)
 31	 Result.success(fowlId)
 32	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 33	 Result.failure(e)
 34	 }
 35	 }
 36	 
 37	 suspend fun updateFowl(fowl: Fowl): Result<Unit> {
 38	 return try {
 39	 firestore.collection("fowls").document(fowl.id).set(fowl).await()
 40	 fowlDao.updateFowl(fowl)
 41	 Result.success(Unit)
 42	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 43	 Result.failure(e)
 44	 }
 45	 }
...
 72	 
 73	 fun getMarketplaceFowls(): Flow<List<Fowl>> = flow {
 74	 try {
 75	 val snapshot = firestore.collection("fowls")
 76	 .whereEqualTo("isForSale", true)
 77	 .get()
 78	 .await()
 79	 
 80	 val fowls = snapshot.documents.mapNotNull { it.toObject(Fowl::class.java) }
 81	 fowls.forEach { fowlDao.insertFowl(it) }
 82	 emit(fowls)
 83	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 84	 // Fallback to local data
 85	 fowlDao.getMarketplaceFowls().collect { emit(it) }
 86	 }
 87	 }
 88	 
 89	 fun getFowlByIdFlow(fowlId: String): Flow<Fowl?> = flow {
 90	 try {
 91	 val snapshot = firestore.collection("fowls").document(fowlId).get().await()
 92	 val fowl = snapshot.toObject(Fowl::class.java)
 93	 fowl?.let { 
 94	 fowlDao.insertFowl(it)
 95	 emit(it)
 96	 } ?: emit(null)
 97	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 98	 // Fallback to local data
 99	 val localFowl = fowlDao.getFowlById(fowlId)
 100	 emit(localFowl)
 101	 }
 102	 }
...
 216

 221	 .whereEqualTo("ownerId", ownerId)
 222	 .get()
 223	 .await()
 224	 
 225	 val fowls = snapshot.documents.mapNotNull { it.toObject(Fowl::class.java) }
 226	 fowls.forEach { fowlDao.insertFowl(it) }
 227	 fowls
 228	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 229	 fowlDao.getFowlsByOwnerSync(ownerId)
 230	 }
 231	 }

 407	 ListingStatus.valueOf(listingStatusString)
 408	 } catch (e: IllegalArgumentException) {
 409	 ListingStatus.ACTIVE // Default fallback
 410	 }
 411	 }

 416	 return deliveryMethod.name

 420	 fun toDeliveryMethod(deliveryMethodString: String): DeliveryMethod {

 425	 }
 426	 }

 35

 41	 recentPhotoUrl = uploadTask.storage.downloadUrl.await().toString()
 42	 }

 13	
 14	@Singleton
 15	class OrderRepository @Inject constructor(
 16	 private val firestore: FirebaseFirestore,
 17	 private val orderDao: OrderDao
 18	) {
 19	 
 20	 suspend fun createOrder(order: Order): Result<String> {
 21	 return try {
 22	 val orderId = order.orderId.ifEmpty { UUID.randomUUID().toString() }
 23	 val orderWithId = order.copy(orderId = orderId)
 24	 
 25	 firestore.collection("orders").document(orderId).set(orderWithId).await()
 26	 orderDao.insertOrder(orderWithId)
 27	 Result.success(orderId)
 28	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 29	 Result.failure(e)
 30	 }
 31	 }
 32	 
 33	 suspend fun updateOrder(order: Order): Result<Unit> {
 34	 return try {
 35	 firestore.collection("orders").document(order.orderId).set(order).await()
 36	 orderDao.updateOrder(order)
 37	 Result.success(Unit)
 38	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 39	 Result.failure(e)
 40	 }
 41	 }
